intro: Orthocryptanthus vasconcelosianus, commonly known as the Brazilian cryptanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. The plant has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces fruit that is a capsule containing numerous seeds. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
